summary: Internal FBI email chain from April 8, 2021, coordinating logistics for FBI agents to assist with monitoring Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense team during a three-day evidence review at the 500 Pearl Street courthouse from April 13-15, 2021. The emails detail security protocols, agent responsibilities, and the presence of an AUSA and SOS personnel.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the evidence review; she is to be produced by the Marshals each morning, monitored by FBI agents, and escorted to the bathroom.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: Will be present all three days at 500 Pearl Street, meeting the agents, and has reserved proffer rooms for the evidence review.

persons.name: SOS
persons.context: Will be present all three days, has been working the case, is familiar with everything, and is copied on the email for agents to contact.

connections.description: FBI agents are responsible for monitoring Maxwell, pulling her from the Marshal cellblock, and escorting her to the bathroom during the evidence review.
The AUSA is prosecuting the case against Maxwell and will be present to oversee the evidence review with the defense team.
SOS is familiar with the case and is available for the assisting FBI agents to reach out to with questions.

events.title: Start of Maxwell Evidence Review
events.description: First day of a scheduled three-day review of evidence by Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense team at 500 Pearl Street courthouse, monitored by FBI agents and an AUSA.

events.title: Three-Day Evidence Review Logistics
events.description: Daily schedule from 9:00 AM to 4:30 PM where Maxwell and her defense team review evidence in a proffer room, with FBI agents providing security and monitoring.

locations: 500 Pearl Street (courthouse, 5th floor proffer room area)
keyFacts: The FBI's Squad C-20 requested 2-3 agents to assist with monitoring Ghislaine Maxwell during a three-day evidence review from April 13-15, 2021.
Agents were required to have a handcuff key and were responsible for escorting Maxwell from the Marshal cellblock and monitoring her throughout the day, including bathroom escorts.
The evidence review was to take place in reserved proffer rooms at 500 Pearl Street, with the evidence unit handling transportation of all evidence to and from the location.
An Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) and an SOS personnel familiar with the case were scheduled to be present all three days to assist and oversee the process.
